The saving grace was that the manager ended up giving us another waitress, who was totally cool and at least SEEMED like she cared how we were doing. The manager that night (11/26/2010) was really cool too - he was giving me a hard time about Alabama losing to Auburn - all in good fun. But the true saving grace was having a Budweiser tap right in our table.  As for the food - I wasn't all that happy. The burger was almost like charcoal and the wings were not good at all. So if you go by food, this would be a 2-star review - but again, having a tap at your table is hard to be too upset about.  If you're in town and there is a sporting event you want to watch, I would recommend this place to come DRINK. Just pray you don't get the same snotty waiter we had, and that the food is better - maybe our cook had an off night.

Although we lost an important game, the ambiance at this sports Station is impeccable! If you are a Habs fan, go there for you playoff games! You won't be disappointed!  The food this time is below average, I ordered a submarine, the bread is hard, it's like it's been there for hours.  As for service, my waiter was great and making sure we have everything we need all the time.  3/5 as an overall is fair for tonight.

Premièrement c'est le plus grand sports Bar que j'ai jamais été,ça doit être qool à une game du ch en playoff.Il ya des tables avec bière en fut(faut faire attention)trop de tv pas assez de deco7.5/10

Came here to watch the Mtl game and ordered the SDS platter. Everything on the platter was oversalted and I only had a bit of everything, half my plate will be thrown out. Ordered a nonalcoholic drink and its as sweet as the maraschino cherries that top it.   I would only recommend this place to watch the games and grab a drink, not for dining.

I really enjoyed this place. When first seeing it, I wasn't too excited about it because it gives the appearance of a sports bar with the set up inside and televisions on the walls, however, they do have outdoor setting with an awning, which was perfect. The menu has various options, and the portions are more than satisfying. The prices are good too, perfect for the student tourist's budget! Service is efficient, but the waitress' attitude could have been nicer (maybe she didn't like Americans, I don't know, but we did leave a generous tip).   Also, I was there on a Sunday afternoon, but on big sporting event nights, this place can get packed/crazy...

Decent. The food looks good, though the menu is littered with fried food items and various poutines. Our server was quite courteous (though a bit confusing). Screens everywhere, but it's a sports bar and should be expected. It can and does get very loud. The drinks are pretty good. Service can take a while though. We've found that the breakfast/brunch cooks don't know the difference between eggs over easy or 'over medium or hard'. Three times they made over easy eggs when it was ordered over hard. They didn't charge for the whole thing, but it was disappointing. But ppl can totally go there and pull the breakfast trick, and not have to pay; it's pretty obvious that they're not gonna improve that part haha

We were a big group looking for a place to sit, drink and grab a bite. The service here was great and people were realy nice but I would never come here again.  Ok if you want to watch spirts this is a great place BUT if you want to drink beer (Bud, Keeths, Shock top and Stella are the only Tap beer and Bud is NOT a beer) or to eat somthing (all the things we ordered were average and below) go someplace else.

Get ready to serve yourself. After they renovated it really went downhill. It looks nicer, but lost its quality. Bad service, too big, prices went up. The cocktails are terrible,  like drinking juice.  Stick to the beer and don't order food.  If youre starving the best choice is probably the souvlaki.  Too loud,  rude about making reservations. Makes you wait, have to show up  at least an hour before play-off games, wont let you sit until everyone is there. You can make a reservation and then still wait in the line? I just dont get it..

Ce qui a commencée notre soirée comme étant un belle découverte a fini par être une des pires expériences que j'ai eu à Montréal. La Station de Sports vient d'ouvrir la plus grande terrasse trottoir que je connaisse en ville. Elle est malade! Ils ont même arrangé des télé dans les fenêtres des édifices qu'ils viennent d'acquérir pour qu'on puisse regarder nos sports favoris (Go L'Impact!) au beau soleil. Par contre, grosse terrasse = beaucoup de beau monde. Ça veut dire que les serveurs et la cuisine vont être occupés en titi! J'y suis allée un mardi soir. On est arrivé à 20h30. Ça pris 5 minutes avant de placer notre commande puis 5 minutes plus tard notre pichet de bière est arrivé. Puis, on a attendu, et attendu, et attendu. L'entrée est arrivée à 21h40, et le repas principal est arrivé à 22h30. C'est beaucoup trop long comme attente. Après avoir mangé notre entrée, vu l'heure qu'il était, j'ai demandé à la serveuse d'annuler mon repas si c'était pour prendre autant que temps parce que je n'avais plus faim rendu à cette heure là. Elle m'a dit que je pouvais soit le prendre pour emporter, ou bien c'est elle qui devait payer ma facture. D'après moi, un serveur ne devrait pas avoir à payer la facture d'un client quand la cuisine n'est pas capable de fournir les repas dans un délai raisonnable. Et un délai de 2 heures pour juste un burger (même pas de frites ou quoi que ça soit d'autre), c'est bien trop long. En plus, l'extérieur du burger était calciné. Mais rendu à ce point-là, je n'avais pas le goût de le dire à la serveuse quand elle est revenue pour nous dire "J'espère au moins que c'est bon". Si je pouvais, je donnerai un gros 10 étoiles à notre serveuse pour son service. Elle est revenue nous voir souvent et était honnête dans son inquiétude par rapport à la lenteur du service. Je l'ai adoré. Mais pour ce qui est de la gestion d'une grosse terrasse, puis de faire payer les serveurs pour quelque chose qui est hors de leur contrôle, ça c'est pas fort.

It's first time to visit this place , I find that it has quite & nice atmosphere with some big tv screens to watch some sport games during weekends , friendly staff, excellent service, delicious food, reasonable prices.
60 minutes d'attente pour une salade césar qui a comme seule qualité d'être propre à la consommation humaine. Première et dernière expérience. Gérant et personnel arrogant.

We went to Les 3 Brasseurs for lunch and our amazing waiter recommended this place when I asked for a shit rowdy sports bar with cheap beer. It did NOT disappoint! We were just two but the place wasn't super busy so they let us sit at the table with the tap. The beer is stupid cheap, cheaper than anywhere I've had it in the States, and you can't turn in any direction without facing a TV. The menu is huge and we didn't try the food, but everything was cheap too. We are definitely hitting this up next time we come to Montreal!

Dropped in late one evening looking for a quick meal, and a drink when everything else was closed.  It's a sports bar, with minimal atmosphere, relying on all the screens to provide that.  The service was quick and bilingual, a relief as my French is limited! Had a steak which was well priced and cooked.  If you are looking for somewhere to catch up on the World Cup I would recommend it.
LOTS of TVs. cheap greasy food. great terraces in the front and back

Ma première fois à La Station des Sports et pas ma dernier   Arrivée à 18:30 on était 6 personnes pour manger et boire et après regarde l'événement de WWE clash of champions    La serveuse vraiment très très bon service 10 étoiles même plus   Le gérant est très gentil on lui a poser quelque questions et on a eu nos réponses qu'on voulait pour un événement plus tard en 2018   Nous avons pris en entrées  1 Nachos au steak moi j'ai pris 1 Nachos au poulet qui est vraiment bon mon amie a pris les quesadilla au poulet et 8 ailes de poulet épicée avec 1 Grand pichet de Budweiser 4L a partagés 29.95$  En plat principal vers 20:30  Moi j'ai pris la 1/2 cotes levée avec purée de pomme de terre et salade de chou vraiment très bon la sauce et sucrée et épicée mes pas trop  Mon autre amie on pris le steak et frites très bonne portion pour 19.95 mon autre amie a pris le sous marin spécial station all-dressed avec smoked meat  Sont garçons a pris le menu pour enfants 1 thé glacé avec le chicken nuggets et la crème glacé en dessert  mon autre amie a pris l'entrée de tout en un ses 3 ailes de poulet 3 pelure de pomme de terre farcie 3 popper au jalapeño et frites    En dessert 2 gâteaux au chocolat vraiment des très gros gâteaux 6 rangée de haut et 1 gâteaux red velvet   Très bonne soirée bonne bouffes et bonne bière et boisson et excellent services
